subtitleNullable: AI4Biology: Classification of bacteria by mass spectrometry
descriptionNullable:
A competition of bacteria classification algorithms up to a strain and detection of new strains based on mass spectrometry data. A task is provided by Artificial Intelligence Research Institute AIRI and Federal Research Centre of Epidemiology and Microbiology named after Honorary Academician N. F. Gamaleya, Ministry of Health.

Identification of bacteria is needed for research in various fields, including disease diagnostics, infection treatment and environmental studies. One of modern methods for bacteria identification is MALDI-TOF (matrix assisted laser desorption ionization-time of flight mass spectrometry). The MALDI-TOF analysis results in spectra of proteins that may be used to characterize bacteria (see Figure).

![](https://n-ws-f21jf.s3pd02.sbercloud.ru/b-ws-f21jf-ny6/AI4Biology/figures/example.png)

image info
Figure. An example of E.coli mass spectrum obtained using MALDI-TOF (Jia-Jun, Y. U., et al. "Development and characterization of a linear matrix-assisted laser desorption ionization mass spectrometer." Chinese Journal of Analytical Chemistry 46.4 (2018): 463-470.; Fig. 9) . The X axis shows the mass to charge (m/z), while the Y axis shows the peak intensity.

The difficulty in identifying bacteria lies in the fact that the same bacterium analyzed in different experiments will have some differences in the obtained mass spectra.
